content: 7 7 7 fitfoodartshop com facebook instagram stacey@fitfoodart com 3 seam it up line up the edges of your long rectangle using one of your yarn tails and a darning needle run the tail through each stitch on both edges now you should have a cylinder tube shape click here for a helpful whip stitch video tutorial close it up using the yarn tail run your yarn needle through the loops around one edge of your tube until you reach where you started then you ll run the tail back through half of the loops a second time and pull tight to close you ll weave in the yarn tail later run your yarn needle through the loops around the other edge of your pumpkin leaving a small opening next add enough stuffing to hold the shape of your pumpkin but do not over-stuff the amount will vary depending on the size you re going for before closing completely insert your stick and pull the tail very tight weave in and hide any yarn tails *use hot glue if needed to secure your stick/stem
